verb.description: Live in or at a specified place.
examples: groups of gypsies still dwell in these caves

verb.description: Think, speak, or write at length about (a particular subject, especially one that is a source of unhappiness, anxiety, or dissatisfaction)
examples: I've got better things to do than dwell on the past

noun.description: A slight regular pause in the motion of a machine.

origin: Old English dwellan lead astray, hinder, delay (in Middle English tarry, remain in a place), of Germanic origin; related to Middle Dutch dwellen stun, perplex and Old Norse dvelja delay, tarry, stay.
